decks.notes: This deck focuses on controlling the game through disruption, resource denial, and graveyard synergies. It uses cards like Thoughtseize, Smallpox, and Malevolent Rumble to disrupt the opponent's game plan while using Life from the Loam to recur lands and fuel the graveyard. Urza's Saga and Eumidian Hatchery provide additional value and threats. The deck also has a combo element with Grist, the Hunger Tide and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis. Overall, the deck aims to grind out opponents through attrition and value while maintaining control of the game.

This Legacy deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. Using cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Lavinia, Azorius Renegade to control the board, alongside powerful creatures like Starfield Shepherd and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd to quickly close out games. Utilizing counterspells like Force of Will and removal like Swords to Plowshares to handle threats, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of disruption and aggressive creatures, ultimately leading to victory through efficient play and smart decision-making.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize Cloudpost as a ramp engine to quickly generate mana and cast powerful spells. By playing cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Kozilek's Command, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up its own win condition. The inclusion of cards like Chalice of the Void and Force of Will provide additional control over the game, allowing the deck to dictate the pace and direction of the match. With a focus on mana acceleration and disruption, this deck aims to overpower the opponent with its powerful spells and threats.

The main concept of this Legacy 1 vs 1 Combo - Cloudpost Ramp deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Cloudposts and Glimmerposts to play powerful threats like Karn, the Great Creator, Ugin, Eye of the Storms, and The One Ring. The deck also includes disruption elements like Force of Will and Chalice of the Void to control the game, while also having cards like Stock Up and Kozilek's Command to draw cards and deal with opposing threats. Sink into Stupor can disrupt the opponent's hand, and Thundertrap Trainer can provide additional value and synergy with the deck's overall strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the Death & Taxes archetype to disrupt the opponent while applying aggressive pressure. The deck includes a variety of removal spells, disruptive creatures, and equipment to control the board and outvalue the opponent. With a focus on tempo and resource denial, the deck aims to dismantle the opponent's game plan while establishing a strong board presence to secure victory. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion adds a versatile threat to the deck, allowing for additional card advantage and flexibility in gameplay.

The key concept of this Dragon Stompy deck is to disrupt opponents by playing powerful lock pieces like Blood Moon, Chalice of the Void, and Magus of the Moon, while also using aggressive creatures like Broadside Bombardiers and Fury to apply pressure. Karn, the Great Creator helps tutor for key artifacts like The One Ring and Soul-Guide Lantern, providing additional utility. The deck also runs powerful removal spells like Sundering Eruption and efficient mana sources like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide to quickly deploy threats and disrupt opponents' game plans.

The deck focuses on quickly putting powerful creatures into play from the graveyard using cards like Entomb, Reanimate, and Animate Dead. It also utilizes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Daze to protect its combo pieces. By efficiently assembling the combo and disrupting the opponent's game plan, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier to quickly close out the game.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Brainstorm, then reanimate them onto the battlefield using cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to control the game and protect the combo. The key is to efficiently utilize graveyards as a resource for powerful creatures while maintaining control of the game through disruptive spells.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly deploy threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying continuous pressure. By utilizing efficient spells like Lightning Bolt and Daze, along with powerful creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler, the deck aims to control the board and win through aggression. The inclusion of counterspells like Force of Will and disruption cards like Wasteland and Stifle further increase the deck's ability to control the game, while also providing the necessary tools to protect its threats and stay ahead in tempo.

The main concept of this Doomsday Combo deck is to quickly assemble the necessary cards to cast Doomsday and use it with precision to set up a winning combination with Thassa's Oracle. The deck focuses on fast card selection and manipulation with cards like Ponder, Brainstorm, and Personal Tutor, as well as protection with Force of Will and Daze. The deck aims to quickly dig through the library and set up a winning combo before the opponent can disrupt it, ultimately leading to a decisive victory.

This Legacy 1 vs 1 deck focuses on utilizing the combo potential of Nadu, Winged Wisdom along with support cards such as Nomads en-Kor and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The deck includes protection spells like Force of Will and removal like Swords to Plowshares to control the board. It also includes card advantage and selection tools like Brainstorm and Ponder to find key pieces of the combo. The inclusion of Green Sun's Zenith allows for tutoring creatures like Noble Hierarch or Sylvan Safekeeper. The mana base consists of fetch lands and dual lands for consistency and flexibility.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the Cephalid Breakfast combo to win the game. By using cards like Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor in combination with Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, the deck can mill through its library to ultimately put Thassa's Oracle on the battlefield and win the game. The deck also includes protection with Force of Will and disruption with cards like Swords to Plowshares. Urza's Saga can be used to search for key combo pieces, making the deck consistent and powerful in Legacy 1 vs 1 format.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt opponents' strategies while putting pressure on them with aggressive creatures. Cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Lavinia, Azorius Renegade help to control the board and slow down opposing decks, while creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Ocelot Pride provide a quick clock for the opponent to deal with. The deck also includes various control elements like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to handle threats. Additionally, the mana base is designed to disrupt opponents' mana resources with cards like Wasteland.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor combo to mill out the entire deck and then use Narcomoeba and Dread Return to bring back Thassa's Oracle for a win condition. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Nadu, Winged Wisdom provide card advantage and protection. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to protect the combo. Urza's Saga adds consistency to find key pieces and Prismatic Ending provides removal for opposing threats.

This Legacy combo deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bringing them back onto the battlefield to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize to protect the combo pieces, along with powerful threats like Murktide Regent and Archon of Cruelty. The goal is to efficiently reanimate big threats while controlling the game with counter magic and disruption, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with a powerful board presence.

The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to control the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Time Raveler, along with efficient removal spells such as Swords to Plowshares and Prismatic Ending. The deck also aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Force of Will and Flame of Anor, while also providing card advantage and manipulation with Brainstorm and Ponder. The inclusion of creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Thundertrap Trainer adds versatility to the deck's game plan, making it a well-rounded control deck in the Legacy format.
